title: 2015 Singapore Cup
text:
The 2015 Singapore Cup was the 18th season of Singapore's annual premier club <a href="Association%20football">football</a> tournament organised by <a href="Football%20Association%20of%20Singapore">Football Association of Singapore</a>. Due to sponsorship reasons, the <a href="Singapore%20Cup">Singapore Cup</a> is also known as the <a href="RHB%20Bank">RHB</a> Singapore Cup. <a href="Balestier%20Khalsa">Balestier Khalsa</a> were the defending champions, having won their first trophy the previous year. <a href="Albirex%20Niigata%20Singapore%20FC">Albirex Niigata (S)</a> were the eventual winners, beating <a href="Home%20United%20FC">Home United</a> 2–1 in the finals.
Teams.
A total of 11 teams participated in the 2015 Singapore Cup. 8 of the teams were from domestic <a href="2015%20S.League">S.League</a> and the other three were invited from <a href="United%20Football%20League%20%28Philippines%29">the Philippines</a>, <a href="Cambodian%20League">Cambodia</a> and <a href="Lao%20League">Laos</a>. Both <a href="Courts%20Young%20Lions">Courts Young Lions</a> and <a href="Harimau%20Muda%20B">Harimau Muda B</a> did not participate in this edition of Singapore Cup.
Format.
Six teams were drawn for the preliminary round while the other five teams will receive a <a href="Bye%20%28sports%29">Bye</a> in that round. They will play against one another in a single-legged knockout basis. Winners of this round will progress and advance to the <a href="2015%20Singapore%20Cup%23Quarter-finals">quarter-finals</a>. Thereafter, matches are played in <a href="Two-legged%20tie">two legs</a> with the exception of the one-match finals. Unlike the previous season, <a href="away%20goals%20rule">away goals rule</a> does not apply.
For any match in the knockout stage, a draw after 90 minutes of regulation time is followed by two 15 minute periods of <a href="Overtime%20%28association%20football%29">extra time</a> to determine a winner. If the teams are still tied, a <a href="Penalty%20shoot-out%20%28association%20football%29">penalty shoot-out</a> is held to determine a winner.
Knockout phase.
Preliminary Round.
The draw for the preliminary round was held on 17 April 2015 at the Ocean Financial Centre’s Event Plaza. Six teams involved in this round will play in a single leg knockout basis. The matches will be played from 22 to 27 May 2015. Winners of this round will progress and advance to the <a href="2014%20Singapore%20Cup%23Quarter-finals">quarter-finals</a>.
Quarter-finals.
<a href="Albirex%20Niigata%20%28S%29">Albirex Niigata (S)</a> and <a href="Geylang%20International">Geylang International</a> will join five other teams in this round after winning their matches in the Preliminary Round . All matches will be played in a two-legged knockout basis. Away goal rule will not be applied in this tournament. Fixtures will be announced on a later date and winners of this round will progress and advance to the <a href="2015%20Singapore%20Cup%23Semi-finals">semi-finals</a>.
